comments: Easiest A I\'ve ever gotten, I took him online and he left insightful feedback to all the assignments and essays. Overall, there are only ten modules with one big essay (very easy). If you read the textbook, follow all the instructions to the last detail you will get an A. I wouldn\'t take anyone else

comments: If you\'re taking this class online you can honestly probably get away with the book. The discussions were heavy and had many parts to them because he designed them to where it\'s an essay, and discussion combined. Well organized course.

comments: Dr. Hopkins is a great professor I took him online. Every Sunday there\'s an essay and a quiz due. It seems like a lot but he\'s not a tough grader so just give it your all and you\'ll pass the class!

comments: TAKE HIM! TAKE HIM! TAKE HIM! Great professor. Papers are due every Sunday as well as quizzes. Do the reading and the papers and you\'ll get a A guaranteed.

tag_professor: Gives good feedback (5)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Get ready to read (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (2)  Participation matters (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)
comments: Great prof, very helpful feedback on papers/assignments. Prompt responses. Would absolutely take him again. Online, 16wk course. Made an A.

tag_professor: Gives good feedback (5)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Get ready to read (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (2)  Participation matters (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)
stu_tags: GET READY TO READ  LOTS OF HOMEWORK  TOUGH GRADER
comments: Humanities was a class I really took interest in; whoever, once the class started there was so much work involved it was hard to retain everything I read. There is a lot of reading, 6 tests within the week, every other week a research paper or discussion. 3 major exams, and one extra credit assignment. A true challenge for full time students

tag_professor: Gives good feedback (5)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Get ready to read (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (2)  Participation matters (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)
stu_tags: GET READY TO READ  LOTS OF HOMEWORK  GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK
comments: The class was alright. There is a lot of work for an online class. There is 250 word essay posts each week and a quiz and regular class work. You have to read the text book to get the quiz answers because the online work really doesn\'t cover it. If you really don\'t want to do work I would not recommend this class. Teacher is cool by the way.

tag_professor: Gives good feedback (5)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Get ready to read (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (2)  Participation matters (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)
comments: Mr. Hopkins class was pretty straight forward. You have a 10 question quiz every week and either a discussion post or 250 word \'essay\' as well. Easy A if you just follow directions, work load isn\'t took much at all. I was able to get through the whole semester without a textbook. Always responded and always got and A.

tag_professor: Gives good feedback (5)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Get ready to read (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (2)  Participation matters (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)
stu_tags: GET READY TO READ  GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK
comments: Professor Hopkins is amazing! I took his HUM2270 class online and I have to admit although you can get an A in this class, it will take a lot of research and reading. It is well worth it though, I learned so much. Do not recommend taking his class in the summer. One discussion, 1 journal, 1 quiz per week, Midterm and final test. Responds quickly.

tag_professor: Gives good feedback (5)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Get ready to read (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (2)  Participation matters (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)
comments: Weekly quizzes, four journals (5 paragraphs each) and four discussion post (200 words each)throughout the class. A cultural experience project (waste of time). A midterm and final exam. The class wasn\'t that hard, but the work was wayy to much. Quizzes are simple as long as you read.

tag_professor: Gives good feedback (5)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Get ready to read (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (2)  Participation matters (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)
comments: quizzes on the chapter every week, journal entries (500 word essays) or discussion post every week. three unit exams instead of a midterm and final. offered extra credit essay, but it didn\'t seem worth the effort for 50 extra point. as long as you read the chapters and put effort into your writings, you\'ll get an A. not easy, but not hard

tag_professor: Gives good feedback (5)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Get ready to read (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (2)  Participation matters (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)
comments: He is awesome. It is not an easy class but it definitely is doable. It is extremely organized and his instructions are thorough. I am never confused about what is going on in his assignments and when you email him, he emails you right back. I am incredibly happy that I had him.

tag_professor: Gives good feedback (5)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Get ready to read (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (2)  Participation matters (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)
comments: Do not recommend this teacher at all. I am usually an A/B student but his online class is atrocious. Assignments are due on Sunday night which threw me off & his quizzes are insanely hard. Even if you read the section (sometimes 50 pages) & take notes they\'re still hard. He words them just so that any answer could be right. Don\'t waste your time.

tag_professor: Gives good feedback (5)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Get ready to read (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (2)  Participation matters (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)
comments: Prof. Hopkins is my favorite so far! He explained in multiple ways exactly how to get an A in his class. He used posts, email, his syllabus and even video! He made the class fun and engaging, but not too difficult. He assigns a discussion post weekly and an essay bi-weekly. Mid-term & final use chapter-order.

tag_professor: Gives good feedback (5)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Get ready to read (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (2)  Participation matters (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)
comments: My second favorite porofessor! He really cares and he would anwser my e-mails in a day! He also bumped my grade up to the next grade because I couldn\'t do some of the assignments! Very nice and helpful! You will read a lot. The class isn\'t and easy "A," but if you do the work you will get a good grade!

tag_professor: Gives good feedback (5)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Get ready to read (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (2)  Participation matters (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)
comments: DO NOT TAKE THIS INSTRUCTOR UNLESS YOU ARE A ENGLISH MAJOR! Loved the first Humanitys class i took so thought i would tale 2270, HATED THIS CLASS! Im not sure if he realizes he is NOT teaching an english class. Hated this class, do not recomend him at all. Got an A in my first humanitys, struggled to get a B- in this class. Dont take him!

tag_professor: Gives good feedback (5)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Get ready to read (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (2)  Participation matters (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)
comments: Read syllabus, watch videos, and read his documents of what he requires of you. He will tell you how to get a good grade. It\'s not hard! I didn\'t read one chapter, just reviewed the titles of the paragraphs and used the index to answer test questions. Tests are 10 questions with 20 min time limit. Exams are a bit tricky.

tag_professor: Gives good feedback (5)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Get ready to read (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (2)  Participation matters (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)
comments: Great teacher and super easy. I will agree with previous posts that sometimes there are questions on the quizzes and tests that were not spelled out in the text, however I believe this is to test whether or not you understood the material. As long as you do the reading and follow the rubrics, you will do fine. Museum report was super easy, too.

tag_professor: Gives good feedback (5)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Get ready to read (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (2)  Participation matters (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)
comments: Although there is alot of work (others already noted posts, journal, museuem etc) involved in this class(took online) he is fair on grading and gave examples of what is acceptable etc. the only thing the quiz questions did not coincide with the online practices from the book. if you do the work you will pass!

tag_professor: Gives good feedback (5)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Get ready to read (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (2)  Participation matters (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Caring (1)
comments: Hopkins was a nightmare. Never replies to emails. Workload is atrocious> I took him twice got a D first time (So did my wife) We are A students. The second time I had to drop my mother died from Cancer during his midterm He was the only one who would not give me an exception. Do yourself a favor and get A good instructor.
